text: Hey <@U2H1Q3F8R> this should work for fonts. Could you try this (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/fa20d8c5fba258ceaf6bfc1b908895d83c788635/src/fields.json#L38>)? You can also add `"colors": true` to the visibility rules in that example.

Hello Developers,

Exciting news! The CMS Boilerplate now includes Theme functionality. Check out the latest release <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/releases|here> and make sure to watch the repository for all the latest updates.
Would I use a regular choice field instead of the special font field if I wanted to use a set of fonts outside of Google?
Although it would be cool to add custom fonts at the top of the font module to keep the experience consistent.

<@U8THBCFC4> One simple use case for additional field types in themes would be content that should appear in multiple modules. Simplest example I can think of would be social media URLs/usernames. It's pretty common for those to appear in both the header and footer, maybe in a sidebar, etc. Using global content, you have to set them in every unique location instead of all in once place, even though they're all the same.
